datafield.subfield: Search for the decay B0 -> phi gamma
13 pages, 2 figures, 1 table, submitted to Physical Review D (RC)

We have searched for the decay $B^{0} \to \phi\gamma$ using the full Belle data set of $772\times 10^6$ $B\overline{B}$ pairs collected at the $\Upsilon$(4S) resonance with the Belle detector at the KEKB $e^{+}e^{-}$ collider. No signal is observed, and we set an upper limit on the branching fraction of $\mathcal{B}(B^{0} \to \phi\gamma) < 1.0 \times 10^{-7}$ at 90\% confidence level. This is the most stringent limit on this decay mode to date.
Niigata U., Grad. Sch. Sci. Tech.
Niigata U., Grad. Sch. Sci. Tech.
Niigata U., Grad. Sch. Sci. Tech.
Niigata U., Grad. Sch. Sci. Tech.

00004 Projections of the four-dimensional fit: (a) $M_{\rm bc}$ in the $\Delta E$ signal region; (b) $\Delta E$ in the $M_{\rm bc}$ signal region; (c) $C'_{\rm NN}$ in the $M_{\rm bc}$ and $\Delta E$ signal regions; and (d) ${\rm cos}\,\theta_\phi$ in the $M_{\rm bc}$ and $\Delta E$ signal regions. Plots (a), (b), and (d) also require $C'_{\rm NN} > 1$. The points with error bars show the data; the dotted (red) curves represent the signal; the dashed-dotted (magenta) curves represent continuum events; the dashed (green) curves represent the charmless background; and the solid (blue) curves represent the total.

00000 Electroweak penguin (top) and gluonic penguin (bottom) contributions to $B^0 \ra \phi\gamma$.
Throughout this paper, charge-conjugate decay modes are implicitly included unless stated otherwise

As our upper limit is obtained using a Bayesian method, it corresponds to 90% However, we use the (frequentist) term following common convention
